title: Lag fix please
body:
Hey guys, so I've been playing LoL for a few weeks now with no issues, but ever since the S6 patch I started getting random lag spikes but it was bearable.

Now for the last 4 days straight I cannot play a single game without sitting on average around 300-400ms but it drops to 26ms (Its usual ms) every few minutes for a few seconds. Hardware is not the issue and my internet on speedtest is over 36mb/s

Any help guys? Running it on Windows 10 on a Toshiba Satellite laptop with 8gb/ram, 2gb/Video card etc

I've changed DNS through adapter settings to one that is apparently 41.7% faster and flushed DNS through CMD with no help at all

Please help and thank you.

replies.body:
Hey Saraphrim,

I'm sorry to hear that you're encountering connection issues to the League of Legends servers. Before we start looking at factors that may be causing these issues on the ISP end, I'd first like to confirm that the issue does not lay on your end of things. Can you try as many solutions as you can that are provided in the [**Troubleshooting Connection Issues**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) Riot Games Support article?

If those solutions don't work, let's start looking into the diagnostics and see where the issue may be originating. To do this, we'll need you to provide some information for us: 

1. Confirmation that you've tried the solutions in the Troubleshooting Connection Issues article
2. ISP that you're using
3. Region and/or State
4. Trace Route (Tracert) - If you're unsure how to do this, check out [**this guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq2)
5. When did these issues begin occurring, and how often?
6. Additional information you'd like to provide

Thank you for your time.

Thank you so much for you hastily reply, I did all but these 3

Packet loss
Packet buffering
Port forwarding

But the issue seems to have been solved, its sitting on a nice 28-32ms now 
Still the occasional ping spike but its no issue

Thank you!
Fantastic! Thanks for sharing the great news!

I'm back with the same problem, it lasted a total of but 3 games and its my lag is back to sitting on 29ms one second and 900 the next constantly changing all game. And I've tried all the troubleshooting connection issues.

I'm from Brisbane, Australia
With Telstra 
I don't know how to attach the Trace Route?
The issues started 2 weeks ago.
I hope you can help and thank you

Tracing route to 103.240.227.5 over a maximum of 30 hops

The Tracert looks fine, so I'm at a loss. You may just need to try troubleshooting this issue with Riot Games Player Support. Sorry I couldn't be of more help. 

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new
Its all good, thanks for your help though! Hopefully I can get it fixed
